content: this legal text summarizes the progress of a cause that took place in antwerp the procedure lasted for 5 years and 3 months starting in october 2015 and ending in february 2021 the text explains the rights of creditors particularly personal creditors and their ability to object to the liquidation process to protect their interests disputes related to claims from third parties are resolved outside of the liquidation process and fall under the jurisdiction of the court the case involved a liquidationdivision divorce and separation of property the text also explains the process of assessing disputed debts within a judicial liquidation procedure creditors can pursue their claims against the partners involved as long as they qualify as estate creditors personal creditors have the right to initiate the division of the undivided estate and recover their share from the debtors final distribution disputes regarding claims from third parties are handled by the court which may appoint a notaryliquidator to advise on the matter the text further explains that the case involves a dispute between a man and a woman going through a divorce and liquidating their assets three creditors have voluntarily intervened in the proceedings the court appoints a notaryliquidator to handle the liquidation and distribution of assets and personal creditors have the right to object to the distribution the court is responsible for resolving disputes related to the liquidation and the notaryliquidator does not have the power to make decisions on disputed claims the costs of the proceedings are reserved and the court of appeal declares the appeal admissible
